summary: The concept of an ecosystem, traditionally defined by specific spatial and temporal boundaries, has evolved to encompass various forms of organizations beyond natural environments. Modern usage reflects a shift in understanding human organization, interpreting it as a living system. Contemporary ecosystems in arts, society, and business transcend time and space, requiring intentional design for healthy development. The article introduces 'ecosystem architecture,' a multidisciplinary approach to create thriving environments.
excerpt: Ecosystem now describes various forms of organizations beyond natural environments, reflecting a shift in understanding human organizations as living systems transcending time and space requiring design for development.
